block.p: Alexandra McKenzie Childs, a daughter of Margaret Burden Childs of Fairfield, Conn., and Daniel R. Childs of Noroton, Conn., was married yesterday to Malachy Joseph McKee, a son of Bernadette and John McKee of Dungannon, Northern Ireland. Judge James B. Zagel of the United States District Court in Chicago officiated at the home of the bride's mother.

Mrs. McKee, 30, is studying for a master's degree in education at the Open University in Milton Keynes, England. She graduated from Boston College and received two certificates in advanced French from the Sorbonne in Paris. From 1995 to 1998 she was a managing editor at Stewart, Tabori & Chang, the publisher in New York.

Alexandra McKenzie Childs, a daughter of Margaret Burden Childs of Fairfield, Conn., and Daniel R. Childs of Noroton, Conn., was married yesterday to Malachy Joseph McKee, a son of Bernadette and John McKee of Dungannon, Northern Ireland. Judge James B. Zagel of the United States District Court in Chicago officiated at the home of the bride's mother.

Mrs. McKee, 30, is studying for a master's degree in education at the Open University in Milton Keynes, England. She graduated from Boston College and received two certificates in advanced French from the Sorbonne in Paris. From 1995 to 1998 she was a managing editor at Stewart, Tabori & Chang, the publisher in New York.

The bride's father is a retired partner in William A. M. Burden & Company, an investment concern in New York. Her mother is the chairwoman of the company and a director of the Florence V. Burden Foundation, a New York charitable organization named for the bride's great-grandmother.

The bridegroom, 32, is a construction site surveyor in Dungannon, where he graduated from the East Tyrone College of Further Education. His mother retired as a nurse's aide for the National Health Service, and his father is a company director at Calderwood & Hamilton, a retailer of household goods.
